title: How Amish Grow Millions Of Crops Without Fancy Equipment

subtasks: Examining each plant with care
Picking ripe fruits at their prime
Canning fruits, vegetables, and sauces
Drying herbs, fruits, and vegetables
Fermenting foods like sauerkraut and pickles
Gathering as a community
Collaborating to build a new barn
Using animal power instead of modern machinery
Practicing crop rotation
Utilizing natural fertilizers
Employing companion planting
Using greenhouses to extend growing season
Selecting strong specimens for seed selection
Passing down heirloom seeds through generations
